com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.objects.data_analytics

Class AnalyticThreadTriggerBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikanow.aleph2.data_model.objects.data_analytics.AnalyticThreadTriggerBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class AnalyticThreadTriggerBean
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Defines a potentially complex trigger for the analytic bean
    Author:
    Alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean
      Either a specific trigger instance, or a boolean grouping of trigger instances (can nest indefinitely)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected AnalyticThreadTriggerBean() 
        AnalyticThreadTriggerBean(Boolean enabled, String schedule, Boolean auto_calculate, AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean trigger) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Boolean auto_calculate()
      If true (defaults to false if "trigger" is specified, true otherwise) ignores "trigger" and auto-generates the dependencies as a set of ANDs of the external inputs in the job list
      Boolean enabled()
      If true (default if a trigger object exists) then a trigger is specified, if false then this job will only be run manually
      String schedule()
      If no complex trigger is set, then the analytic thread is run on this frequency (eg in some human readable format ("every 5 minutes", "hourly", "3600" etc) If a complex trigger is set, then this field determines how often the trigger is tested (In which case, it defaults to some sensible value (possibly changing with system load), order minutes not seconds or hours)
      AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean trigger()
      The complex trigger or triggers for this thread (optional)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AnalyticThreadTriggerBean

        protected AnalyticThreadTriggerBean()

      • AnalyticThreadTriggerBean

        public AnalyticThreadTriggerBean(Boolean enabled,
                                 String schedule,
                                 Boolean auto_calculate,
                                 AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean trigger)
        Parameters:
        schedule - - If no complex trigger is set, then the analytic thread is run on this frequency, else determines the poll frequency of the complex trigger
        auto_calculate - - whether the auto-calculate override is set
        trigger - - The complex trigger or triggers for this thread (optional)

    • Method Detail

      • enabled

        public Boolean enabled()
        If true (default if a trigger object exists) then a trigger is specified, if false then this job will only be run manually
        Returns:

      • schedule

        public String schedule()
        If no complex trigger is set, then the analytic thread is run on this frequency (eg in some human readable format ("every 5 minutes", "hourly", "3600" etc) If a complex trigger is set, then this field determines how often the trigger is tested (In which case, it defaults to some sensible value (possibly changing with system load), order minutes not seconds or hours)
        Returns:
        the schedule in human readable format

      • auto_calculate

        public Boolean auto_calculate()
        If true (defaults to false if "trigger" is specified, true otherwise) ignores "trigger" and auto-generates the dependencies as a set of ANDs of the external inputs in the job list
        Returns:
        whether the auto-calculate override is set

      • trigger

        public AnalyticThreadTriggerBean.AnalyticThreadComplexTriggerBean trigger()
        The complex trigger or triggers for this thread (optional)
        Returns:
        - The complex trigger or triggers for this thread (optional)
